definition: to search/to demand/to ask/to exact/large rope/isolated
surname Suo/abbr. for 索馬里|索马里[Suo3 ma3 li3], Somalia
to have no interest in sth

sentences.english: Talking with them are tedious so I can't help shaking head and sighing.
sentences.chinese: 跟这些人谈话真是索然无味，因此才摇头叹息。
不幸的婚姻使我们兴味索然。

sentences.english: Some things are fun the first time you do them------ and then not so much the next.
sentences.chinese: 有些事情第一次做兴致昂然，之后再做就索然无味了。

sentences.english: I see many students taking pre-medical courses with joyless tenacity.
sentences.chinese: 我见过许多上医科预备课程的学生趣味索然地苦撑。

sentences.english: The wine has no taste. The food sickens you.
sentences.chinese: 美酒索然无味，佳肴令你恶心。

sentences.english: Many people left the party before it ended because it was very dull.
sentences.chinese: 聚会索然无味，许多人在结束前就离开了。

sentences.english: It’s as bland as a sugar-free cookie.
sentences.chinese: 这真是跟无糖的曲奇饼干一样，索然无味啊。

sentences.english: The rainy day drearied the football match.
sentences.chinese: 雨天使足球赛变得索然无味。

sentences.english: If he was absent for even an hour, they seemed to lose their gaiety .
sentences.chinese: 如果他有一个小时不在，他们仿佛也会意兴索然。

sentences.english: They are silent very static, stand aloof from the worldly affairs, to everything all uninterested.
sentences.chinese: 他们沉默好静，与世无争，对任何事情均兴味索然。

sentences.english: The conclusions on all three headings are rather bleak.
sentences.chinese: 这三个方面得出的结论都比较索然无味。

sentences.english: Parties switched him on but they seemed to switch her off.
sentences.chinese: 社交聚会使他兴致勃勃，可她似乎兴味索然。

sentences.english: Trinket's elation quickly vanished and he went off disconsolately to change back into his eunuch's uniform.
sentences.chinese: 韦小宝登时意兴索然，便去换了小太监的服色。

sentences.english: Her counterpart left in vain and vapidity.
sentences.chinese: 对方索然无味，徙劳而去。

sentences.english: Conversation will turn to be disinteresting without alcohol when doing business with them.
sentences.chinese: 与山东人谈生意，没有酒，谈话就索然无味。

definition: as if one had lost something (idiom)/to look or feel unsettled or distracted/to feel empty
to lose all interest in life (idiom)
tastes as if one is chewing wax (idiom)/tasteless/insipid
to have no interest in sth
bored/to be fed up with/sick and tired of sth
bored to death (idiom)/bored stiff/overcome with boredom
to not know the reason/to not know what to do
